title: Tutorial needs more detailed explanation on the semicolon.
body:
by **minkoo.seo**: 
Current tutorial explains semicolon like this:

"""
Notice that we can group declarations of the same sort into parenthesized,
semicolon-separated lists if we want, as on lines 7-10 and 14-17. But it's
not necessary to do so; we could have said

    const Space = " "
    const Newline = "\n"

Semicolons aren't needed here; in fact, semicolons are unnecessary after
any top-level declaration, although they are needed as separators within a
parenthesized list of declarations. 
"""

And this is not really easy to understand. (And it doesn't mention curly
braces at at all.) Instead of just explaining when they're not needed,
please explain when they're needed also.

One suggestion:

"""
Semicolons are optional for top level constructs. For example, import (Line
7-10), var(Line 12), const(Line 14-17), func(Line 19-32) do not have
semicolon at the end of line 10, 12, 17 and 32. 

However, in general, semicolons are needed for constructs insides top level
construct. Statements inside either parenthesis or inside curly braces need
semicolon.
"""
